region and is a lively fortified ‘bastide’ town, built during the 13th century.  Traditional in its ways, Mirande provides the visitor with a truly local French experience.
A small town it has a main square surrounded by attractive medieval arcades and an original 15th century

that stands proud looking over the town.

During the month of July you can enjoy the vibrancy of Mirande’s
.  Mirande is also well known for other celebrations; traditional feasts, dances, concerts and plays that take place in the central square.

Take a stroll around its small network of streets, visit the regular markets filled with local produce from this agricultural area and enjoy a coffee at one of its delightful cafes.

Visit the museum of Fine Arts and China.
Small selection of shops, but not a shopping mecca!  Regular markets.
